item.author: Bob Condotta, The Seattle Times
item.description: SEATTLE — For most of his decadelong career in Seattle, one overriding narrative surrounding Russell Wilson is that he never received a vote for NFL MVP. And depending on who you believe, it was something that reportedly gnawed at Wilson himself, and led to some friction at times over play-calling and Wilson’s role in the offense. But one reason Wilson never received a vote for MVP was the ...
item.content:encoded:
SEATTLE — For most of his decadelong career in Seattle, one overriding narrative surrounding Russell Wilson is that he never received a vote for NFL MVP.

And depending on who you believe, it was something that reportedly gnawed at Wilson himself, and led to some friction at times over play-calling and Wilson’s role in the offense.

media:content.media:title: Quarterback Russell Wilson #3 of the Seattle Seahawks leads his team onto the field to start the NFC Wild Card Playoff game against the Los Angeles Rams at Lumen Field on January 09, 2021, in Seattle, Washington.
